transportAdvice: Whistler Village is compact and highly walkable, with the main ski areas, shops, and restaurants all within easy reach on foot. A free public transit system serves the village and surrounding neighborhoods, and taxis are available for longer trips or late-night travel.

weather.description: Cold and snowy with excellent ski conditions; expect heavy snowfall at elevation and occasional rain at village level.
Peak ski season with reliable snow; cold temperatures and frequent snowfall make for ideal winter sports conditions.
Late ski season with longer daylight hours; snow remains good at altitude while the village begins to warm slightly.
Spring skiing is possible early in the month but snow coverage becomes patchy; mild and increasingly rainy at lower elevations.
Ski season ends and the mountain transitions to summer activities; expect frequent rain and lush green scenery emerging.
Early summer brings warming temperatures and the opening of mountain biking and hiking trails; some rain is still common.
The warmest and driest month of the year; ideal for hiking, mountain biking, and outdoor festivals with long sunny days.
Warm and mostly sunny with excellent conditions for all summer outdoor activities; the busiest tourist month of the year.
Warm days and cool nights with fewer crowds; fall colors begin to appear and conditions remain great for hiking and biking.
Autumn brings cooler temperatures and increasing rainfall; a quieter shoulder season as the resort prepares for winter.
Early snowfall arrives at higher elevations and anticipation builds for ski season; cold, wet, and relatively quiet in the village.
Ski season opens and the village comes alive for the holidays; expect cold temperatures, snowfall, and a festive atmosphere.
